| 2337                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want to calculate my P&L View's Forecasted [Billable Accounts] Internal Revenue using Powerbill data combined with EDW data, so that I can observe accurate financial trends of the sites for which I'm responsible.<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System automatically identifies applicable deal types for the selected site<br>System retrieves deal structure information from Powerbill<br>System pulls relevant budget data from EDW based on deal types<br>System calculates each Internal Revenue component using appropriate formulas with escalators<br>System combines all Internal Revenue components and adds Other Revenue from Forecast<br>System displays the initialized P&L View with calculated Internal Revenue values<br>Admin user can review the Internal Revenue data broken down by deal type<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Budget<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [BUDGET_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL]*(-1)<br>SELECT SUM([BALANCE]) AS BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[BUDGET_FINAL] AS budget<br>JOIN [TP_EDW].[dbo].[CHART_OF_ACCOUNT] AS coa ON budget.MAIN_ACCOUNT = coa.MAIN_ACCOUNT<br>WHERE [COST_CENTER] = '0170'<br>AND [PERIOD] = '202503'<br>AND [IS_SUMMARY_CATEGORY] = 'INTERNAL REVENUE'<br>------------------<br>BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>-279663.89000<br>Forecast - Billable Accounts<br><br>Steps to calculate Billable Accounts portion of Internal Revenue (when enabled)<br>1. QUERY FOR CONFIGURATION DETAILS OF BILLABLE ACCOUNTS IN SITE CONTRACT DETAILS<br>            a. ADDITIONAL PAYROLL AMOUNT<br>            b. PTEB TYPE<br>                        i. ACTUAL PTEB<br>                        ii. % OF BILLABLE PAYROLL<br>                                    1.  % AMOUNT OF PAYROLL<br>                        iii. ESCALATOR TYPE<br>                                    1. FIXED $<br>                                    2. % INCREASE<br>                        iv. ESCALATOR AMOUNT<br>            c. SUPPORT SERVICES<br>                        i. FIXED $<br>                        ii. % OF PAYROLL TYPE<br>                                    1. % OF BILLABLE<br>                                                a. % AMOUNT<br>                                    2. % OF TOTAL<br>                                                a. % AMOUNT<br>2. QUERY FOR LIST OF NON-EXCLUDED BILLABLE ACCOUNTS IN DATAVERSE CONTRACT DETAILS<br>3. QUERY FOR NON-EXCLUDED BILLABLE ACCOUNTS LIST FROM OTHER EXPENSES FORECAST TAB IN DATAVERSE THAT CONTAIN FORECASTED VALUES <> 0<br>4. SUM(NON-EXCLUDED, NON-FORECASTED BILLABLE ACCOUNTS 6000 - 7999 FROM BUDGET_FINAL)<br>5. SUM(VALUES CONTAINING FORECASTED AMOUNTS IN NON-EXCLUDED ACCOUNTS FROM OTHER EXPENSES TAB IN DATAVERSE)<br>6. SUM(ACCOUNT BALANCE RESULT OF #3, ACCOUNT BALANCE RESULT OF #4)<br>NOTES ON WORKFLOW TO CALCULATE BILLABLE ACCOUNTS PORTION OF FORECASTED INTERNAL REVENUE<br>• If enabled, 1-A should be added to IR calc as-is.<br>• If enabled, 1-b-i should do nothing, presumably we are excluding or not excluding PTEB account values from BUDGET_FINAL due to the Non-Excluded accounts list without additional work.<br>• If enabled, 1-b-ii should trigger an additional amount to be added to final IR amount, by taking the % amount in 1-b-ii-1 times the sum of the PTEB accounts (6200 - Payroll Taxes, 6399 - Health Insurance Allocation, and 6500 - Insurance - Worker's Comp) that are Non-Excluded.<br>• If enabled, starting on the Period which will first use the amount, we should add an amount to the IR total that equals this % or $ increase of the non-excluded PTEB (whether that is defined as the balances from BUDGET_FINAL PTEB accounts that are non-excluded, or whether it is simply a % of Billable Payroll... IR from the escalator effective date and forward should reflect this increase<br>• If enabled, 1-C should be added to the IR amount as either a fixed $ or as a % of Billable (Payroll - PTEB) or a % of Total Payroll (all Non-excluded accounts in the 6000 - 6999 range).<br>• The result of query 2 should be used to filter in query 3 so that we are only gathering values entered by Account Managers in accounts that are non-excluded from billing to the customer (ie: if BUDGET_FINAL has an actual value for the account, then we should use that to forecast and we only replace it with a forecast value when an Account Manager has taken explicit action to type it into the Other Expenses tab).<br>• The list of accounts that were found by 3 query to have an Account-Manager-Entered value should be used to filter out values from the SUM operation in 4.  This is to ensure we are using the Account Managers input to drive Internal Revenue for Billable Accounts and not always relying on Budget data.<br>• Step 4 gathers the amounts the Account Manager is predicting in any of these specific accounts which are non-excluded<br>• Step 5 add the non-excluded accounts which have been budgeted for use in Internal Revenue forecast, but where the account manager has no way to actually input a forecast, improving the accuracy of the Internal Revenue forecasting process for Billable Accounts<br> | Scenario 1: Display Billable Accounts in P&L View when enabled without Management Agreement (sprint 28 only)<br>Given I am viewing the P&L for a site where Billable Accounts is enabled<br>And Management Agreement is disabled for the site<br>When the P&L view loads<br>Then the Internal Revenue section should include api data for ""Billable Accounts"                  | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want to initialize my P&L View's Internal Revenue using Powerbill data combined with EDW budget data, So that I can observe accurate financial trends of the sites for which I'm responsible.<br>User Flow<br>Account Manager navigates to the Forecasting module in the system<br>Account Manager selects a site from their assigned locations<br>Account Manager selects the ""P&L View"" from the navigation menu<br>System automatically identifies applicable deal types for the selected site<br>System retrieves deal structure information from Powerbill<br>System pulls relevant budget data from EDW based on deal types<br>System calculates each Internal Revenue component using appropriate formulas with escalators<br>System combines all Internal Revenue components and adds Other Revenue from Forecast<br>System displays the initialized P&L View with calculated Internal Revenue values<br>Admin user can review the Internal Revenue data broken down by deal type<br>Data Element<br>Data Use Category<br>Example Formula<br>Example Queries / Notes<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Budget<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [BUDGET_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL]*(-1)<br>SELECT SUM([BALANCE]) AS BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[BUDGET_FINAL] AS budget<br>JOIN [TP_EDW].[dbo].[CHART_OF_ACCOUNT] AS coa ON budget.MAIN_ACCOUNT = coa.MAIN_ACCOUNT<br>WHERE [COST_CENTER] = '0170'<br>AND [PERIOD] = '202503'<br>AND [IS_SUMMARY_CATEGORY] = 'INTERNAL REVENUE'<br>------------------<br>BUDGETED_CATEGORY_MONTHLY_TOTAL<br>-279663.89000<br>INTERNAL REVENUE<br>Forecast<br>[INTERNAL REVENUE] = [FIXED FEE IR] + [PER OCCUPIED ROOM IR] + [PER LABOR HOUR IR] + [REVENUE SHARE IR] + [BILLABLE ACCOUNTS IR] + [MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT IR] + [OTHER REVENUE (from Forecast)]<br>WHERE<br>              <br>                [PER LABOR HOUR IR] = [FORECASTED HOURS PER | 2309                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Forecasting | As an Account Manager using the Forecasting system, I want intuitive cell selection, editing, and content duplication capabilities in data tables, So that I can efficiently enter and manipulate numerical data with minimal effort and time.<br>User Flow<br>User navigates to a Forecast tab (e.g., Statistics, Rates, Payroll)<br>User views the data table containing cells with numerical values<br>User selects a cell by clicking on it (cell becomes outlined in blue)<br>User can:<br>Type any number key and see that number appear immedately<br>Paste clipboard content using Ctrl+V to replace cell contents<br>Drag the cell's handle to copy its value to adjacent cells in the same column<br>Click TAB to move one cell to right<br>Click ENTER to move one cell down<br>Technical Notes<br>The cell selection highlight (blue outline) is NOT a separate step from the text selection highlighting when selecting cell with mouse, TAB, or ENTER<br>The drag handle should be visually distinct and intuitive (small square, similar to Excel)<br>Vertical-only dragging should be enforced through UI constraints, not just visual cues                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | Scenario 1: Cell Content Highlighting on Focus<br>Given I am logged into the Forecasting system<br>And I am viewing a data table on any Forecast tab<br>When I change focus on a cell containing data<br>Then the entire content of the cell should be highlighted (text selection)<br>And the cell should remain in edit mode<br>And any keystroke I make should replace the highlighted content<br>Scenario 2: Paste Operation with Ctrl+V<br>Given I am viewing a data table on any Forecast tab<br>And I have copied content to my clipboard<br>And I have a cell selected (indicated by blue outline)<br>When I press Ctrl+V<br>Then the current cell content should be completely replaced with my clipboard content<br>And the cell should maintain its selected state<br>And the system should validate the pasted content matches expected data type (numeric)<br>And show appropriate error feedback if validation fails<br>Scenario 3: Cell Content Duplication via Drag Handle<br>Given I am viewing a data table on any Forecast tab<br>And I have selected a cell (indicated by blue outline)<br>When I hover over the selected cell<br>Then I should see a small handle appear at the bottom-right corner of the cell's blue outline<br>Given I can see the cell's drag handle<br>When I click and drag the handle upward or downward<br>Then the system should show a preview of the cells that will be filled<br>And the system should only allow vertical dragging (up or down the column)<br>And the system should prevent horizontal dragging (left or right across rows)<br>And the top cell value should be the clipboard (for single-cell copy moving down screen)<br>And the bottom cell should be used as the clipboard (for single cell copy moving up screen)<br>STRETCH GOAL: And for multiple-cell copy/paste, the cell selection process must happen separately from the paste values process; <br>And the same number of cells selected as copy source should be a common denominator when compared to the number of cells identified as paste target (eg: if 3 are selected to copy, you can only paste into 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, etc... cells as target)<br>And the copy source cells and the paste target cells may not contain the same cells<br>And the paste operation will cause the same pattern of numbers to appear in the paste target when both are compared in the same direction (top to bottom or bottom to top)<br>Given I have dragged the cell handle to cover multiple cells in the column<br>When I release the mouse button<br>Then all cells covered by the drag operation should be filled with the original cell's value<br>And the system should validate all filled values match expected data types<br>And show appropriate error feedback if validation fails for any cell<br>Scenario 4: Cell Handle Visibility Rules<br>Given I am viewing a data table on any Forecast tab<br>When no cell is selected<br>Then no drag handles should be visible on any cells<br>Given I have selected a cell<br>When I click on a different cell<br>Then the handle should disappear from the previously selected cell<br>And should appear on the newly selected cell<br>Given I have selected a cell<br>When I move my mouse away from the selected cell<br>Then the handle should remain visible as long as the cell remains selected<br>Scenario 5: Multi-Select and Copy<br>STRETCH GOAL: Given I am on the Stats table<br>When I click to select multiple cells<br>Then for multiple-cell copy/paste, the cell selection process must happen separately from the paste values process; <br>And the same number of cells selected as copy source should be a common denominator when compared to the number of cells identified as paste target (eg: if 3 are selected to copy, you can only paste into 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, etc... cells as target)<br>And the copy source cells and the paste target cells may not contain the same cells<br>And the paste operation will cause the same pattern of numbers to appear in the paste target when both are compared in the same direction (top to bottom or bottom to top)<br>Scenario 6: Paste area not the same size as copy area<br>Given the  Paste area not the same size as copy area<br>When I paste the values on clipboard<br>Then the paste operation throws a warning dialog to user that ""Paste area not the same size as copy area, please select a different set of cells."" |

row appears between Sat and Sun rows of data table, to provide visual clarity as to where a weekend falls in the grid<br>Step 2: Navigate Between Pages<br>User clicks ""Next"" button to view second month days<br>System updates table to show Page 2 data<br>Rows shown are July 1st - July 31st<br>User can click ""Previous"" to return to Page 1<br>User can see current page indicator (e.g., ""Page 2 of 3"")<br>Step 3: Review Pagination Information<br>User views pagination status showing ""Showing 31-62 of 92 days" | 2136                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Forecasting | As an Account Manager, I want to forecast payroll costs at both Job Group and Job Title levels based on hours and hourly rates, so that I can accurately project labor costs and internal revenue for both standard and per-labor-hour contract sites<br>Background<br>The payroll forecasting system needs to support two contract types:<br>Standard Sites: Forecast only at Job Group level (e.g., ""Bell"", ""Parking Management"")<br>Per Labor Hour Sites: Forecast only at Job Title level (e.g., ""Bell Attendant"", ""Garage Attendant"")<br>For Per Labor Hour sites, forecasted hours will also drive internal revenue calculations using billable rates from contract details.<br>User Flow<br>Step 1: Access Payroll Forecasting<br>User navigates to the Payroll tab<br>System displays the dual timeline interface with Scheduled/Actual data (left) and Forecast data (right)<br>User selects desired time horizon (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly)<br>Step 2: Determine Forecasting Level<br>System checks Customer Site contract details for ""Per Labor Hour"" setting<br>If Per Labor Hour = Disabled: Only Job Group level forecasting is available<br>If Per Labor Hour = Enabled: Only Job Title level forecasting is available<br>Step 3: Job Group Level Forecasting<br>User expands a date period to view Job Groups<br>User clicks on a Job Group forecast bar (e.g., ""Bell"")<br>System opens forecast dialog showing:<br>Job Group name and date<br>Current total hours for the group<br>Average hourly rate for the group (calculated from all job titles)<br>Current forecast cost (hours × average rate)<br>Budget comparison values<br>User enters new hours forecast<br>System calculates new cost using: New Hours × Average Hourly Rate per Job<br>System distributes hours proportionally across all job titles in the group<br>User confirms changes<br>Step 4: Job Title Level Forecasting (Per Labor Hour Sites Only)<br>User expands a Job Group to view individual Job Titles<br>User clicks on a Job Title forecast bar (e.g., ""Bell Attendant"")<br>System opens forecast dialog showing:<br>Job Title, Job Code, and date<br>Current hours forecast<br>Average Hourly rate for this specific job title<br>Billable Rate for this specific job code (if configured in Contract Details)<br>Current forecast cost (hours × cost rate)<br>Current forecast revenue (hours x billable rate)<br>Budget comparison values<br>User enters new hours forecast<br>System calculates new cost using: New Hours × Job Title Average Hourly Rate<br>System calculates new revenue using: New Hours × Job Code Billable Hourly Regular Rate (up to 40 hours/wk) and New Hours x Job Code Billable Overtime Rate (over 40 hours/wk)<br>System updates Job Group totals automatically<br>User confirms changes<br>Step 5: Revenue Impact Calculation (Per Labor Hour Sites Only)<br>For each job title with forecasted hours:<br>System checks if Job Code has billable rates configured in Contract Details<br>If billable rates exist:<br>Calculate regular revenue: Min(Hours, 40) × Regular Billable Rate<br>Calculate overtime revenue: Max(0, Hours - 40) × Overtime Billable Rate<br>Add to internal revenue forecast<br>If no billable rates: No revenue impact calculated<br>Step 6: View Updated Forecasts<br>System updates all forecast bars with new values<br>Variance indicators show if forecasts exceed budget thresholds<br>Job Group totals reflect sum of all job title forecasts<br>Internal revenue projections update automatically (Per Labor Hour sites)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | AC1: Contract Type Detection<br>Given I am on the Payroll tab<br>When the system loads payroll data<br>Then it should check the Customer Site contract details for ""Per Labor Hour"" setting<br>And enable/disable Job Title level forecasting accordingly<br>AC2: Job Group Forecasting (Non-PLH Sites)<br>Given I am viewing the Payroll forecast panel<br>When I click on a Job Group forecast bar<br>Then a dialog should open showing Job Group details<br>And I should be able to enter hours forecast<br>And the system should calculate cost using the average hourly rate for that group<br>And hours should be distributed proportionally across job titles in the group<br>AC3: Job Title Forecasting (Per Labor Hour Sites Only)<br>Given my site has Per Labor Hour contract details enabled<br>When I expand a Job Group and click on a Job Title forecast bar<br>Then a dialog should open showing Job Title specific details<br>And I should be able to enter hours forecast for that specific job title<br>And the system should calculate cost using the job title's specific hourly rate<br>AC4: Job Title Forecasting Restriction (Standard Sites)<br>Given my site has Per Labor Hour contract details disabled<br>When I expand a Job Group<br>Then individual Job Title bars should not be clickable for editing<br>And only Job Group level forecasting should be available<br>AC5: Hourly Rate Calculations<br>Given I am forecasting payroll<br>When the system calculates costs<br>Then it should use the specific hourly rate for each job title<br>And Job Group average rates should be calculated as the weighted average of all job titles in that group<br>AC6: Hours Input Validation<br>Given I am entering hours in a forecast dialog<br>When I input a value<br>Then the system should accept decimal values (e.g., 7.5 hours)<br>And validate that hours are non-negative<br>And show real-time cost calculations as I type<br>AC7: Revenue Impact (Per Labor Hour Sites)<br>Given my site has Per Labor Hour contract details enabled<br>And I forecast hours for a job title with configured billable rates<br>When I save the forecast<br>Then the system should calculate internal revenue using regular rates for up to 40 hours/week<br>And use overtime rates for hours exceeding 40/week<br>And update the internal revenue forecast accordingly<br>AC8: Revenue Impact Exclusion<br>Given I forecast hours for a job title<br>When that job title has no billable rates configured in contract details<br>Then no internal revenue impact should be calculated<br>And the forecast should only affect payroll costs<br>AC9: Automatic Aggregation<br>Given I update a job title forecast<br>When I save the changes<br>Then the parent Job Group totals should update automatically<br>And the overall period totals should recalculate<br>And all dependent calculations should refresh<br>AC11: Data Persistence<br>Given I have made payroll forecast changes<br>When I navigate away from the Payroll tab and return<br>Then all my forecast changes should be preserved<br>And calculated values should remain consistent<br>AC13: Error Handling<br>Given I am forecasting payroll<br>When required contract details are missing (hourly rates, billable rates)<br>Then appropriate error messages should display<br>And the system should gracefully handle missing data<br>And provide guidance on what configuration is needed<br> <br>
